author: betre@dccc.org
title: House Speaker Says GOP Has "Obligation" to "Eliminate" Medicaid. What Will Monica De La Cruz Do?
text: De La Cruz & House GOP would risk health coverage for 27,000 people in TX-15 With inflation rising and the price of eggs hitting all time highs, Monica De La Cruz and House Republicans are scheming to rip away health coverage for millions of American families to fund tax breaks for billionaires and wealthy corporations. House Speaker Mike Johnson doubled down on the GOP bait and switch, telling Punchbowl News that he intends to cut Medicaid: “We have a stewardship obligation to root that out and eliminate it.” Last week, far-right Republicans scored a huge victory when the Budget Committee adopted an amendment that ensured Republicans would seek at least $1.5 trillion in cuts to vital programs like Medicaid. Despite campaigning on making life more affordable for Texans, De La Cruz is poised to do just the opposite. DCCC Spokesperson Nebeyatt Betre: “Monica De La Cruz knows exactly what she is doing. After Republicans accepted millions of dollars from billionaires like Elon Musk, they are choosing to screw over hardworking families with cruel cuts to Medicaid in order to fund tax breaks for their same billionaire backers.” ###

author: T13
title: Dj Mendez se sincera: “Sigo amando Chile”
text: Leopoldo Méndez sorprendió tras sus declaraciones en el programa de [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sZg5f_OUcKI&ab_channel=CanalKike21) de Kike Morandé. El músico y productor chileno, conocido como DJ Méndez, se sinceró con el animador y habló de cómo ve la actualidad del país. También se refirió a la depresión que lo llevó a irse de Chile y volver a Suecia con su familia. “Chile es como es Chile (...) Todo el mundo se quiere cagar a todo el mundo. Entonces sufrí de varios personajes que se metieron en mi camino. Poca o mucha inversión que hacía no resultaba y salía pa’ tras. Entonces, eso me fue afectando y desgastando las ganas de estar aquí en chile”, explicó. Debido a esto, buscó ayuda profesional y descubrió que estaba pasando por una depresión, que se desencadenó principalmente por estar alejado de sus hijos, quienes viven en Suecia. “No hay profesional en el mundo que me pueda ayudar de la forma que me entregan mis hijos”, confesó A pesar de todo, el músico volvió a Chile y actualmente está emparejado con Beatriz Fuentes, una chilena de 32 años. Incluso, se tatuó “Bea” en una mano. “Me viste ella, ella me elige la ropa”, dijo Dj Mendez. Un último disco: El objetivo de DJ Méndez En la conversación con Kike Morandé, surgió el tema de la violencia en el país, situación que ha sorprendido a DJ Méndez en su regreso a Chile. [ Lee También > Globos de Oro 2024: ¿Cuándo, a qué hora y dónde ver la premiación? ](/noticia/tendencias/cuando-donde-seran-globos-de-oro-2024-5-1-2024) “Es lamentable pero así está Chile, es triste verlo. Yo he tenido muy malas experiencias pero sin embargo sigo amando Chile. Me gusta lo positivo y me quedo con eso. Chile está mal, está la gente agresiva. Tengo grabado mínimo dos tres peleas en pleno semáforo", mencionó. En ese contexto, es que el el DJ confesó tener conversaciones con su pareja sobre tener hijos, pero decidieron dejar de lado esa idea. “Aunque mucho amor sentimos pero de traer a un niño o niña, un bebé a este mundo como está la cosa", dijo el cantante. Además, Leo Méndez le contó a Kike Morandé de sus planes: publicar su último disco e irse a vivir al sur. Actualmente, el creador de "Estocolmo" está preparando un álbum en el que colabora con reconocidos artistas urbanos como el productor Abraham Wayne y Gino Mella. También, está grabando un nuevo reality, esta vez con él de protagonista. "Es como los Méndez pero otra era”, dijo entre risas.

author: Saleen Martin
title: 'May this keep you safe from harm': WWII era Bible returned to New York veteran's family
text: Lost Bible returned to slain USAAF airman from World War II [Saleen Martin](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7245115001/saleen-martin/) During World War II, a woman bought three brothers Bibles to protect their hearts and guide them as they set out for battle. The Bible had a metal cover on the front with the inscription “May this keep you safe from harm." Two of the brothers made it home, while the other, Lt. Edsel J. McKnight of the United States Army Air Forces, was shot down off the coast of France. His Bible was mailed to the family but was lost sometime after. This month, his family finally got it back. Ava Coogan's family is from Albany, New York and they found the Bible in late December while going through their late matriarch’s belongings. On Jan. 11, Coogan met Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law and returned the Bible to her, allowing her to put it back in its rightful place, next to the ones his brothers brought back home from war. ‘I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages’ Coogan’s uncle and mother found the Bible in a stack of books. Their mother, Rosanne Vartanian, died nearly 20 years ago but was a collector and loved garage sales. “It’s just so random that my grandmother had the urge to pick that up,” she said. “She bought random things. There was no rhyme or reason to it. It was with a stack of other books.” Coogan decided to research the Bible and found out soldiers often took them to war. Some can be found in museums. “The whole premise of it was that the metal cover on the front is like a hard shield,” Coogan told USA TODAY. “They would put it in their coat pockets … like the front breast pocket … that cover would protect their heart from bullets.” Lt. McKnight’s name was also written in the Bible, said Coogan, who was drawn to the Bible for some reason. She couldn’t put it down, she recalled. “I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages,” she said. She noticed that the Bible’s front cover had a slice in it, almost like something was underneath it. She examined it more closely and found a piece of paper folded up inside. She asked her uncle for help, who carefully used a butter knife to get the slip of paper out. Once they retrieved the piece of paper from under the Bible’s cover, they saw that it was a plea for the Bible’s safe return to an address not too far away. Although there was no area code, there was a phone number listed, so the family added their own area code and called. “I was just hoping for the best,” Coogan said. “We found out that number worked.” Lieutenant was shot down off the coast of France When Coogan called the number written in the note, she spoke to a woman named Fay, Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law. They organized a meetup on Jan. 11 to return the Bible to the family, who is from Porter Corners, part of Saratoga County in eastern New York. Lt. McKnight served in the U.S. Air Force’s 365th Fighter Group and 388th Fighter Squadron. He was flying in a Thunderbolt fighter aircraft in 1944 when he was shot down off the coast of France, [online records](https://rafbeaulieu.co.uk/honouring-the-airmen-of-raf-beaulieu/) show. Fay told Coogan and her family that Lt. McKnight has two brothers. All three of the brothers served in WWII. Fay’s husband, Ray, said his Bible saved his life. “He got shot during the war and it hit where the Bible was, covering his heart, and the bullet went into his arm instead,” Coogan said. Once Lt. McKnight was killed, his belongings were shipped back home to the family. His sister-in-law had all three Bibles on a bookshelf on display. One day, the family was preparing to go to church. Her nephew borrowed the Bible, but knew it was so precious, the family decided to write a note with contact information in case it were ever lost. “He didn't lose it,” Coogan said. “He brought it back after church and I guess what happened is after someone passed in their family, they had an estate sale … and it just accidentally went out with a stack of books.” It ended up in Coogan’s grandmother’s hands, she said. Returning the Bible to the McKnight family was quite the enlightening experience, Coogan said. “That was really cool because that's when we kind of got to hear their story,” she said.

author: Salon.com
title: Victims take the spotlight back in Louis C.K. documentary | Salon.com
text: A new trailer for a documentary highlighting the pattern of sexual abuse [perpetrated by](https://www.salon.com/2017/11/09/louis-c-k-accused-of-sexual-misconduct-by-five-women-in-blistering-expose/) comedian Louis C.K. addresses the consequences of serial sexual misconduct in a post [#MeToo](https://www.salon.com/topic/metoo) culture. "Sorry/Not Sorry,” which debuted at the Toronto International Film Festival last year, drags out the men — Joe Rogan, Neal Brennan and several other peers — who downplayed C.K.’s victims, made excuses for the comedian, or rejected accusations outright. It also dives into C.K.’s rehabilitation, and his Grammy-award-winning special, asking viewers to examine how the comedian was effectively able to profit off allegations of severe misconduct against him, even after [admitting](https://www.salon.com/2017/11/10/louis-ck-statement-apology/) to inappropriate behavior. But the documentary isn’t just about the perpetrator, or the culture of apology in our media landscape, as the trailer clues. C.K.’s victims are given screen time via new interviews, details from the journalists who broke the story, and input from fellow comedians. Opening with a clip featuring the disgraced comedian — accused in 2017 of masturbating without consent in front of numerous women — he's shown speaking to Charlie Rose — himself accused of misconduct — who compares C.K. to figures like Lenny Bruce, Bob Dylan, and “philosopher kings.” Here, viewers are reminded that C.K.’s legacy is not as damaged as he’d suggest. But throughout the project, the testimony of women who had their careers stalled, and who watched as a man who harassed them clung to a prolific career, shines through. Per an [interview](https://www.thedailybeast.com/louis-ck-documentary-lets-women-he-harassed-have-the-last-laugh) with the Daily Beast, filmmaker Caroline Suh — who directed "Sorry/Not Sorry" alongside Cara Mones — wanted to highlight the story of the victims, not just the perpetrator. “What was really so surprising [in making the film] was learning how hard it is to redirect one’s focus from worrying about the men—why Louis did what he did and what happened to him—to asking why it took so long for anyone to care,” Suh told the Daily Beast. “And most importantly, why we don’t really take much time to think about why women get so much punishment for just saying what happened.” C.K. takes up, like many abusers, the majority of the conversation surrounding his actions. Defenders argue that men like him have had too much of their [career taken away](https://www.salon.com/2019/01/08/why-are-comedy-clubs-still-booking-louis-c-k-comedy-works-ceo-gets-honest-about-the-conflict_partner/), often failing to focus on victims. Last month, fellow comedian Bill Maher amplified these sentiments, saying on an episode of his podcast with Bill Burr that he hoped C.K. would be “welcome[d] back” after he was “canceled.” "People have done so much worse things and gotten less," Maher said. "There’s no rhyme or reason to the #MeToo-type punishments." Watch the trailer for ‘Sorry/Not Sorry’ here ahead of its July 12 release.

author: John Farnam
title: Jews, Israelis, Sovereign Citizens, ...You Can't Trust Them With Guns
text: Opinion “It’s always good to have lifeguards nearby, but it’s better to learn how to swim!” ~ Sam Rosenberg. Joe R Biden’s Administration is, even today, still [refusing to sell 27000 US-manufactured M4 rifles](https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/u-s-blocks-shipment-of-rifles-to-israel-over-concerns-of-west-bank-settler-violence-9764c87d) to Israel, for emergency defense. There are those within the JRB Administration who express concern that some of these rifles could “end up” in the hands of (Heaven forbid!) Israeli civilians, who might actually keep them in their homes for personal/home defense (a drill many Israelis sincerely wish they had practiced prior to 7 Oct 23). “Armed Jews” still apparently represent a truly frightening thought to leftist politicians, both here and ironically in Israel itself! They worry that these weapons might be used to threaten innocent domestic Palestinians (even though no such assaults have occurred). And yet, JRB [nonchalantly abandoned many times that ](https://www.ammoland.com/2022/11/full-list-of-american-weapons-left-afghanistan/)number of American military-grade M4s in Afghanistan during his panicked, helter-skelter “withdrawal” in the summer of 2021. One can only wonder where all that forsaken American [military equipment ended up.[read Hamas]](https://www.ammoland.com/2023/10/afghanistan-weapons-abandoned-by-biden-administration-appear-in-hamas-terror-attacks/) I think it is safe to say that none of it ended up in the hands of Israelis! The real issue here is that even governments that profess to be “enlightened” still don’t trust the very citizens who put them in power. The concept of “armed citizens” (Jews and everyone else) is always morbidly scary to aspiring autocrats who contemptuously look down upon the rest of us and see nothing more than a motley assortment of fools, bigots, clowns, and buffoons, their words! They don’t even trust members of our own (un)armed services, who have courageously volunteered to defend our nation. Leftist politicians will never respect us as sovereign citizens. We will always scare them. They have regard for none of us despite their less-than-honest rhetoric. This absolute reality was well known to our Founders, which is precisely why we have a Second Amendment as part of our Constitution, and it is, therefore, no mystery why leftists are trying so desperately to get rid of it! “I never feel unsafe, except for when the majority is on my side.” ~ Criss Jami. /John Read Related: [Full List of American War Weapons Lost In Afghanistan ~ VIDEO](https://www.ammoland.com/2022/11/full-list-of-american-weapons-left-afghanistan/#axzz8NIBMgfxV) [Afghanistan Weapons Abandoned By Biden Administration Appear In Hamas Terror Attacks](https://www.ammoland.com/2023/10/afghanistan-weapons-abandoned-by-biden-administration-appear-in-hamas-terror-attacks/) About John Farnam & Defense Training International, Inc As a defensive weapons and tactics instructor, John Farnam will urge you, based on your beliefs, to make up your mind about what you would do when faced with an imminent lethal threat. You should, of course, also decide what preparations you should make in advance if any. Defense Training International wants to ensure that its students fully understand the physical, legal, psychological, and societal consequences of their actions or in-actions. It is our duty to make you aware of certain unpleasant physical realities intrinsic to Planet Earth. Mr. Farnam is happy to be your counselor and advisor. Visit: [www.defense-training.com](https://www.defense-training.com/) Live Inventory Price Checker | |

author: elEconomista.es
title: España se despide de una ola de calor "extrema" y agosto llega con tormentas en medio país: estas son las zonas más afectadas
text: El inicio de agosto trae consigo un intenso calor y una serie de fenómenos meteorológicos adversos que activarán avisos en siete comunidades autónomas de España, según la predicción de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET). Las temperaturas pueden alcanzar hasta 40ºC en algunos puntos de Andalucía. Las altas temperaturas activarán avisos importantes en Almería y Málaga, mientras que Córdoba, Huelva, Jaén, Sevilla, Albacete, Gerona, Lérida, Mallorca, Alicante, Valencia y Murcia estarán bajo aviso amarillo. En el caso de tormentas y lluvias, Guadalajara, Lérida, Tarragona, Castellón, Teruel, Barcelona y Gerona estarán en riesgo, con un aviso que sube a naranja para las últimas cuatro localidades. Además, las olas generarán un aviso amarillo en Gerona y Menorca, mientras que las rissagas afectarán a Menorca. En las Islas Canarias, Gran Canaria, La Palma, La Gomera, El Hierro y Tenerife estarán bajo alerta por fenómenos costeros, y Gran Canaria también tendrá un aviso por altas temperaturas. La jornada se caracterizará por la posibilidad de tormentas en la mitad noreste de la península, siendo más probables y fuertes en los Pirineos e Ibérica. En gran parte del país prevalecerá el tiempo estable, con cielos despejados o con nubes altas, aunque en el área cantábrica se esperan intervalos nubosos y precipitaciones débiles. También se formará nubosidad de evolución diurna en los Pirineos y sistemas Ibérico y Central, con posibles chubascos y tormentas dispersas, que ocasionalmente podrían incluir granizo. La AEMET no descarta tormentas secas aisladas en el valle del Ebro y zonas de la Meseta. En ambos archipiélagos y en el centro y sudeste peninsulares es posible la presencia de calima, y hay probabilidad de bancos de niebla matinales en interiores de Galicia, Cantábrico y alto Ebro. Las temperaturas descenderán en general en la Península y Baleares, especialmente las máximas en zonas del nordeste peninsular, con pocos cambios en Canarias. A pesar de los descensos, se seguirán superando los 35ºC en interiores de la mitad sur y depresiones del nordeste peninsular, y no se descarta que se alcancen los 40ºC en zonas del Guadalquivir. Las mínimas tampoco bajarán de 25ºC en el área mediterránea. El viento soplará alisio moderado en Canarias, con intervalos fuertes en zonas expuestas, y predominarán vientos de componente norte en la mitad norte peninsular y área mediterránea oriental. En general serán flojos o moderados, con intervalos de fuerte en Ampurdán. En el resto de la vertiente atlántica, Estrecho y Alborán soplarán vientos del oeste, con intervalos de poniente fuerte en el Estrecho.

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe
text:
Summary by Ground News Bureau of Meteorology data showed many towns across Queensland sweltering through near-40-degree Celsius heat at 10am on Friday. On the coast, Brisbane had reached 37.5C at 1:00pm on Friday while the Gold Coast was expecting to hit 33C. In the outback, temperatures were tipped to skyrocket to 47C in Birdsville. West and central Queensland as well as the Top End were set to suffer some of the most extreme heat. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
ABC Australia Lean Left High Factuality Government: Australian Government Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe Much of northern Australia is battling through a heatwave with conditions set to peak over the weekend and remain into the New Year. As scorching temperatures hit storm-ravaged communities, residents get creative to keep cool.

author: Shinu
title: #68 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja más de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#0](c0#c-0) Ese titular es tendencioso y confuso, y probablemente seas consciente. El ataque no fue durante una misa, como quiere dar a entender, si no que se atacó una serie de aldeas de manera coordinada. Y además, el factor religioso no es el único relevante, y tampoco está plenamente confirmado.
Hay fuentes mucho más serias, informadas y rigurosas que la que has mandado...
[#10](c10#c-10) Resulta difícil creer que puedan existir fuentes más serias leyendo maravillas cosas como:
La reciente matanza sucedida en Navidad confirma lo que anuncian las estadísticas: el cristianismo es la religión más perseguida en el mundo. Y no se limita solamente a esta región de África, sino que ocurre en Asia y Medio Oriente. Hace poco a cristianos perseguidos por el régimen comunista chino se les negó asilo en la España de Pedro Sánchez y el PSOE. Solo una lo pudo obtener porque su salud le impedía subir al avión donde la deportaban.
Todo ello, mientras las pateras siguen llegando a España, posiblemente con insurgentes tan radicales como los que masacran a los cristianos en Nigeria y sin el amparo para los cristianos que huyen de estos.
[#65](c65#c-65) Las muertes no son sensacionalistas, la noticia es sensacionalista, y su falta de rigor, una falta de respeto a los que han sido asesinados. Además de aprovechar que el Pisuerga pasa por Valladolid para seguir esparciendo odio y desinformación...
No sé tú, pero yo este tipo de cosas ni las tolero ni me quedo callada, prefiero no ser cómplice de estas miserias.
Mira, igual en que en Gaza, pero estos no lo llaman masacre.
https://www.lavanguardia.com/internacional/20231217/9456963/iglesia-denuncia-israel-mato-sangre-fria-dos-feligresas-gaza.html
https://es.zenit.org/2023/12/12/22-cristianos-muertos-en-gaza-cohete-sin-detonar-hallado-en-parroquia/
[#53](c53#c-53) ridiculizarlo si quieres.... Pero con Israel tenemos todo tipo de relaciones y bien estrechas, vamos de aliados, van de ser occidente, medio entran en europa, sobre todo socialmente, democracia plena etc etc ... No tiene absolutamente nada que ver.
Esto es una masacre genocida por supuesto, ejem
[#2](c2#c-2) .... Pro no es comparable. Si acaso, comparable a la masacre de Hamas.
[#61](c61#c-61) Con Israel si, con Gaza no, mediáticamente deberíamos estar recibiendo un bombardeo de lavado de cara de Israel, pero es al contrario. Lo que esté bien o mal no me meto, no soy experto, pero la actitud de los medios ha cambiado y eso me inquieta.
Es como si dentro de un mes encontramos todos los medios diciendo que Aznar ha sido el peor presidente, que hipotecó a España para décadas. Sería inquietante, llevan décadas lavándole la cara a Aznar y que cambien de rumbo significaría que algo ha pasado o que está habiendo algún cambio de poderes de influencia.
[#9](c9#c-9) bueno. Entérate quién financio al valeroso pueblo de Afganistán y sus valerosos guerreros los muyahidines( les dedicaron Rambo iii y todo), o quien armó y financio a Irak, a estos que ves ahora este terrible atentado de la noticia, quien los organizo y financió, ... Después nos vuelves a contar estás cosas. Y si sigues pensando que está irán detrás de todo pq es omnipresente vale. Si ves q algún otro estado puede estar implicado, fijate quién lo arma y financia. Un saludo.
[#13](c13#c-13) lo se y lo he criticado 100 millones de veces, dinero de EEUU y Arabia Saudita y Pakistán.
